intro: Struthanthus rufus, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, red or orange-pink flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Struthanthus rufus is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
